conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions Committee—I'm Student_E. I’m very interested in joining School_D because I value a strong academic environment and a community where I can contribute consistently. I would be excited to enroll if admitted, and I’m ready to commit promptly. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C, but I am only 4th in School_C's priority list, so an immediate [APPLY] is likely to be rejected if higher-priority students apply there. My second choice is School_B, where I am last in priority, so that's also unlikely. School_D is 2nd choice in its priority list (after Student_D), making it my best realistic option to secure a high-ranked match early. I will apply to School_D now to try to lock in a good outcome before seats fill elsewhere.

conversation.message: Dear Student_E, thank you for your application and your strong interest in School_D. We are pleased to offer you admission. If you are ready to commit, we will finalize your enrollment with us.
conversation.thought: School_D has quota 1 and priorities D > E > C > B > A. In this round, both Student_E and Student_C applied. Student_E is ranked above Student_C on our true priority list, so accepting E now secures a higher-priority match than accepting C. There is a possibility Student_D (our top choice) may apply later, but holding out risks ending unmatched or settling for a lower-priority student; since we already have a high-priority applicant (E), immediate acceptance maximizes expected outcome given limited rounds and competitive dynamics. Therefore accept Student_E and fill the seat.

conversation.message: Hello School_D Admissions, I’m Student_C. School_D is my first-choice school, and I’m very eager to enroll if offered a place. I value your academic environment and would be excited to contribute and commit to attending. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_D. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd), which gives me a realistic chance if I apply immediately before the seat is taken by higher-priority students. Since each school has capacity 1 and School_D is also attractive to others, I should apply now with a clear, committed message.

conversation.message: Dear Student_C, thank you for your application and for naming School_D as your first choice. At this time, our incoming class is already full and we’re unable to extend an offer. We appreciate your interest and wish you the very best with your other applications.
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (Remaining Quota: 0) with Student_E, whom we previously accepted and matched with. Per the rules, if quota is 0 we must reject any new [APPLY], regardless of Student_C’s high priority on our true list. Therefore we must reject Student_C’s application this round.

conversation.message:
Dear School_A admissions team, [APPLY]

School_A is my first-choice school, and I would be excited to commit if admitted. I’m looking for a rigorous environment and a community where I can contribute consistently in academics and school activities. If selected, I will accept and fully prioritize School_A.

Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_A, so I should apply immediately. Even though School_A ranks me 3rd (behind Student_B and Student_D), an early application is my best chance to secure my first choice before seats fill. I will clearly express strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if they are considering among close candidates.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_A,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for naming School_A as your first choice. We’re pleased to offer you admission to School_A, and we appreciate your commitment to fully prioritize us.

We look forward to welcoming you to our community.

[ACTION] [ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_A has quota 1 and ranks Student_A third (behind Student_B and Student_D). Student_A ranks School_A first and has applied, so accepting would lock in a decent match. However, it is plausible that higher-priority students may become available: Student_B ranks School_A third (after School_B and School_D) and Student_D ranks School_A second (after School_C). Student_D is top priority at School_B and School_D, and second at School_C, so Student_D may get pulled away, but could still land at School_A if rejected elsewhere. Student_B is top priority at School_A and also highly ranked at School_C (2nd) and School_D (4th), but may end up at School_B (where B is 3rd) or School_D (where B is 4th). Since only one round has occurred and no other applicants are in the inbox, rejecting Student_A now preserves the option to pursue Student_B/Student_D later, but risks ending with a worse or empty seat if they never apply. Given Student_A's strong commitment and the uncertainty of attracting higher-priority candidates, accept Student_A to secure a solid match rather than gamble.

conversation.message: Dear School_C admissions team, I’m Student_D and I’m applying because School_C is my first-choice school. I’m strongly motivated by your academic environment and would be excited to contribute actively to the school community. If admitted, I will accept and commit to enrolling. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_C. I have relatively strong priority there (3rd after Student_C and Student_B). Given capacity 1, I should apply immediately to try to secure it before others do, and emphasize fit and commitment.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your thoughtful application and for sharing that School_C is your first choice. We appreciate your strong interest and commitment. At this time, however, we are unable to offer you admission.

We wish you the very best in the matching process.

Sincerely,
School_C Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_D is 3rd on School_C’s true priority list (behind Student_C and Student_B). Although Student_D ranks School_C as first choice and would commit, accepting now would fill our only seat and could block a higher-priority student (Student_C or Student_B) from matching with us later in the process. Given the early round and no other constraints, it is strategically better to hold out for a top-2 priority candidate rather than lock in the 3rd choice immediately.

conversation.message: Hello School_B admissions committee—I'm Student_B and School_B is my first-choice school. I’m excited about the academic environment and would strongly commit to enrolling if admitted. I would be grateful for your consideration and the opportunity to join School_B this year.
conversation.thought: My top choice is School_B, so I should apply immediately. Although School_B ranks me 3rd (behind Student_D and Student_A), applying now gives me the best chance to secure my first choice before the seat is taken. I will clearly signal strong commitment and fit to encourage acceptance if they are choosing among multiple applicants this round.

conversation.message: Dear Student_B, thank you for your strong interest in School_B and for sharing that we are your first choice. After reviewing applications in this round and considering our limited capacity, we’re not able to offer you admission at this time. We appreciate your effort and wish you the very best in the remaining process.
conversation.thought: Student_B is #3 on School_B’s true priority list (behind Student_D and Student_A). Although Student_B applied and ranks us #1, accepting now would fill our only seat and could block a higher-priority match. Given full information: Student_D ranks School_B 3rd (after School_C and School_A) and Student_A ranks School_B 4th, so neither is very likely to apply immediately, but they could later if rejected elsewhere. Still, with quota 1 and no other applicants in this round, we can risk rejecting Student_B to hold for Student_D/Student_A. Since the protocol requires ACCEPT/REJECT on APPLY, we must choose; to maximize chance of top-priority match, reject and encourage Student_B to keep options open.

conversation.message:
Dear School_B Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_D and I’m submitting my formal application to School_B. I’m excited by School_B’s academic rigor and the chance to contribute positively to the school community. If offered admission, I will accept immediately and commit to enrolling.

Thank you very much for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_D
conversation.thought: School_C (my top choice) already rejected me, so I should move to the highest remaining school on my true preference list. Among the unmatched schools, School_B is my 3rd choice (higher than School_E). Also, School_B’s priority list ranks me #1, so an [APPLY] should be accepted if they still have capacity. I will clearly state commitment to enroll if admitted.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_D,

Thank you for your application and for your clear commitment to School_B. After reviewing this round’s applications, we are pleased to offer you admission to School_B. We would be excited to have you join our community.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: We have quota 1 and received APPLY from Student_D and Student_C. On School_B true priority list, Student_D is ranked #1 (highest), Student_C is ranked #4. Accepting Student_D immediately secures our top choice and prevents losing them to other schools (Student_D ranks School_C first but also has School_B as #3; School_D and School_A may also compete). There is no benefit to waiting since no one outranks Student_D for us, and we prefer filling with highest-priority candidate. Therefore accept Student_D now.

conversation.message: Dear School_B Admissions, I’m Student_C and I’m writing to formally apply. School_B is one of my top remaining choices, and I’m very interested in joining your community. I value the school’s academic expectations and campus culture, and if offered admission I would be ready to commit and enroll. Thank you for considering my application.
conversation.thought: School_D (my 1st choice) already rejected and School_A is no longer available. Among remaining schools, School_B is my 3rd choice (higher than School_C and School_E). I’m not top priority at School_B, but a direct, committed application is best because waiting could let higher-priority students take the single seat. I will emphasize fit and that I would accept if offered.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Thank you for your application and for your thoughtful interest in School_B. At this time, we have already filled our available seat, so we’re not able to offer you admission in this round. We appreciate your effort and wish you the very best as you continue the process with your remaining choices.

Sincerely,
School_B Admissions Committee
conversation.thought: Our quota is already filled (remaining quota = 0) with Student_D, who is also our top priority on our true priority list. Per rules, with quota 0 we must reject any new [APPLY] messages. Even aside from the rule, replacing Student_D would be strictly worse for us. Therefore, reject Student_C politely and encourage them to continue with other options.

conversation.message:
Dear School_E Admissions Committee,

I’m Student_B. School_E is one of my preferred schools, and I’m applying because I believe I would be a strong fit for your academic community and contribute positively to campus life. If admitted, I would take the offer seriously and am prepared to enroll.

Thank you for your consideration.

Sincerely,
Student_B
conversation.thought: School_B (my top choice) already rejected me and remains unmatched, likely because it is holding out for higher-priority applicants (Student_D, Student_A). With only School_B, School_C, and School_E available, my best remaining true option is School_E (ranked 4th), which also places me relatively high (3rd) in its priority list—better than at School_C (2nd, but School_C likely prefers Student_C first). I will apply to School_E now to secure a match rather than risk ending up at my last choice (School_C) or unmatched.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and your thoughtful note. We appreciate your interest in School_E and would be pleased to offer you admission.

Please confirm that you intend to enroll at School_E.

Sincerely,
School_E Admissions
conversation.thought: Student_B is 3rd on School_E's true priority list (A, C, B, E, D). However, Student_B ranks School_E 4th, so they are unlikely to commit if they can get B, D, or A. Given the market, Student_A and Student_C both rank School_E last, Student_E ranks it last, and Student_D ranks it 4th—so strong applicants to School_E may be scarce. Still, accepting Student_B now risks filling our only seat with a student who may later match to a higher-choice school, but in this protocol an [ACCEPT] creates an immediate match and removes both agents, so we must be confident. Since Student_B has higher-preference options where they are also competitive (e.g., School_A ranks B #1; School_C ranks B #2), they likely will not be available later, but they also may not truly want School_E. With quota 1 and no other applicants this round, the safest way to maximize true priority is to hold out for Student_A or Student_C, but they are least likely to apply to us. Given Student_B explicitly says they are prepared to enroll, and B is still relatively high on our list, accept to avoid ending unmatched.

conversation.message:

Sincerely,
Student_C

I will clearly express commitment to enroll if admitted and highlight fit, while keeping the message concise and formal.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_C,

Sincerely,

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: As School_C, my true priority list ranks Student_C highest. I have 1 remaining seat and no current matches. Student_C has submitted a committed [APPLY]. Accepting now secures my top-choice student and eliminates the risk of ending up with a lower-priority student or an unfilled seat in later rounds. Student_D (ranked below Student_C) already applied and was rejected to preserve capacity for higher-priority candidates. Therefore, I should accept Student_C immediately.
